Republic of Vietnam ( Vietnamese : Việt Nam Cộng Hòa / Republic of Vietnam), Commonly known as South Vietnam , South Vietnam is now the State of Vietnam regime by 1955 Vietnam referendum and restructuring of the establishment of a presidential republic , the capital, to the Saigon (now Ho Chi Minh City ), as the first President Ngo Dinh Diem [1] , has been including the United States in Diplomatic recognition of 87 countries within [2] [3] . During the Vietnam War , South Vietnam and North Vietnam ( Democratic Republic of Vietnam ) confronted each other. In 1975, they were destroyed by North Vietnam and the South Vietnam National Liberation Front .

In 1887, Vietnam became a French colony , World War II and by the time Japan dominated. In 1945, the Vietnam Independent League led by Ho Chi Minh launched the August Revolution to declare Vietnam independent and establish a socialist Democratic Republic of Vietnam, and the first Indochina war broke out with France . In 1949, anti-communist forces supported Nguyen, the emperor , and the emperor Bao Bao in the south of Vietnam to establish Vietnam , and confronted the Democratic Republic of Vietnam in the north. In 1955, Prime Minister Wu Tingyan replaced Bao Dai as the head of state in South Vietnam through the 1955 Vietnamese referendum and established the Republic of Vietnam.

In December 1960, the South Vietnam National Liberation Front (known as the “Vietnamese Communist Party” in the United States) was established, calling for the overthrow of the Republic of Vietnam’s regime, the establishment of revolutionary bases in the southern villages, and subversive activities. The North Vietnamese government supported it through the Ho Chi Minh Trail . South Vietnam gradually lost control of the countryside, and in 1961 US President John F. Kennedy decided to implement a "special war" in South Vietnam to clear the Viet Cong. On November 1, 1963, the South Vietnamese military launched a military coup to overthrow and shot Wu Tingyan. The newly-introduced military government was not very stable. The South Vietnamese political situation fell into chaos that lasted for about a year and a half. During the North Bay incident in 1964, President Lyndon Johnson of the United States sent troops to fight against North Vietnam, and the Vietnam War escalated. It was not until Ruan Wenshao came to power on June 14, 1965 that the political situation in South Vietnam eased.

In 1973, the United States, North Vietnam, South Vietnam and the South Vietnam National Liberation Front signed the " Paris Peace Agreement. " Soon after, US troops basically withdrew from Vietnam, and the Vietnam War became the decisive battle between the North and South Vietnam. In 1975, the Vietnamese People’s Army launched a spring offensive to capture the capital, Saigon , and the Republic of Vietnam perished. After the Viet Cong, the Provisional Revolutionary Government of the Southern Republic of Vietnam was established and Saigon was changed to Ho Chi Minh City. In 1976, under the leadership of the Democratic Republic of Vietnam, the Southern Republic of Vietnam merged with it and unified into what is now the Socialist Republic of Vietnam .

History [ edit ]

Background [ edit ]

See also: French Indochina , the August Revolution , the First Indochina War , the Geneva Conference (1954) and Operation Freedom Road
After the partition of Vietnam, approximately 1 million refugees fled North Vietnam during Operation Freedom Road

World War II before the outbreak, Vietnam belongs to the French colony , is Indochina French part of the whole territory of Vietnam is divided into the northern part of Tokyo protectorate , in the middle of Annam and south of Cochin China three parts. Jiaozhizhi is a colony directly under France, while Tokyo Protectorate and Annan Protectorate are nominally ruled by Hue ’s Vietnamese Emperor Bao Dao , but the real power is still in the hands of the French. Jiaozhi China is the region most affected by France and the area of ​​most interest to the French. The economy is relatively diversified, unlike other regions where rubber cultivation is mainly developed . During World War II, Indochina was under the dual rule of Vichy France and Japan , and was completely controlled by Japan after the March 9th incident . When Japan surrendered in August 1945 and Vietnam was in a power vacuum , the Vietnam Independent League , headed by Ho Chi Minh , launched the August Revolution and overthrew the Bao Emperor of Hue and established the Democratic Republic of Vietnam in Hanoi . On September 10, the British army descended south of the 16th north latitude line landed in Saigon, re-armed the French colonial army detained by the Japanese army, and southern Vietnam returned to French control[4] [5] [6] [7] .

In June 1946, France fostered the independence of Kautzhina , becoming the Nanqi Autonomous Republic . On December 19, 1946, France shelled the city of Hai Phong, and the first Indochina war broke out with the Democratic Republic of Vietnam . June 1949, France decided to rely on the establishment of the puppet regime of ways to improve the situation, the establishment of anti-communism of the State of Vietnam and the selection was in exile in Hong Kong 's Paul the Great, and as "long" (Quốc Trưởng, ie head of state ). Since 1950, the Democratic Republic of Vietnam has received a large amount of military assistance from the People’s Republic of China . In 1950, France also received assistance from the United States through the Common Defense Agreement . The first Indochina war also became part of the global cold war . After the Battle of Dien Bien Fu ended on May 3, 1954 , France no longer prevailed in the war and the two sides began peace negotiations. Facing the retreat of French colonial forces, Emperor Bao must find the support of external forces. For this reason, Wu Tingyan, who was in exile in the United States , was appointed as the cabinet chief on June 26, 1954 . July 11, 1954, meeting in Geneva reached a " Geneva Conference Final Declaration ", decided to Vietnam from north to south of 17 degrees north latitude line will divide and conquer is bounded north by the Democratic Republic of Vietnam(That is, North Vietnam), and the South is controlled by Vietnam . Decided to hold a unified election in 1956 to decide on the issue of Vietnam, but with the support of the United States, the government of Vietnam’s Cabinet Minister Wu Tingyan refused to sign and refused to negotiate with North Vietnam on the issue of unified elections, claiming that the 1956 election “only works if it is completely free. It makes sense" [8] , so the cancellation of this election is justified, and this election could not be held [9] . After the division of Vietnam, the land reform policy pursued by North Vietnam caused turmoil in some areas [10] , and about 1 million refugees fled the communist system of North Vietnam and flooded into the south, known as " Operation of Freedom " [11] [12] .

The era of Wu Tingyan's reign (1955–63) [ edit ]

See also: Wu Tingyan , the 1955 Vietnamese referendum and the death of Wu Tingyan
Wu Tingyan ruled South Vietnam from 1955 to 1963
Catholics in northern Vietnam fled to the south by boat
See also: Freedom Path

In early 1955, he announced the dissolution of French Indochina, Vietnam country at the end Renge Kui Ngo Dinh Diem temporarily took control of the south [13] . On October 23, 1955, Wu Tingyan presided over a referendum to determine the future political system of Vietnam . The referendum was controlled by Wu Tingyan, Wu Tingyan's younger brother. Wu Tingyan was able to abolish the monarchy , expel the Emperor Bao , and establish a republic. US officials believe that in a fair election, Wu Tingyan will receive 60–70% of the votes, while Americans underestimate the number of votes-for example, in the capital of Saigon , Wu Tingyan received more than 600,000 votes (there are only 450,000 people on the electoral roll) . Wu Tingyan used the election as a means to test his authority. October 26, 1955 Ngo Dinh Diem declared himself President of the Republic of Vietnam , the prime minister, defense minister and armed forces chief of staff. [14] Bao Dao lost his power and went into exile in France . The French government and army suffered from the Algerian war and had no time to pay attention to Indochina, and withdrew from Vietnam in April 1956. [15] The new Constitution was adopted by the Constitutional Assembly of the Republic of Vietnam on July 7, 1956. According to the provisions of the Constitution, the newly established Republic of Vietnam adopts a system of separation of powers . The president is elected for a term of 6 years. October 26 is the date of entry into force of the Constitution. [16]

South Vietnam’s ruling clique is to be transferred from the French power circle to the pro-American Wu Tingyan. For this reason, the US Navy ’s Freedom Trail operation transported approximately 1 million North Vietnamese to the south, mostly Catholics. CIA 's Edward Lansdale Captain Ngo Dinh Diem had helped strengthen his rule [17] , launched a propaganda war, in order to encourage as many refugees to move south. This effort has a dual purpose: to increase the number of Catholics in particular, and to increase the total population of the South, in order to win the 1956 reunification election. These include sending South Vietnamese spies to the north to spread rumours of imminent doom, such as hiring fortune-tellers to predict disasters under communism, the CCP ’s invasion and plunder, and claims that the US military will use nuclear weapons in North Vietnam . Wu Tingyan also used the slogans " Christ has come to the south" and " Virgin Mary has left the north" to lure Christians south, asserting that under Ho Chi Minh's rule, Catholicism will be persecuted. More than 60% of the Catholics in the north moved to Wu Tingyan's South Vietnam, which enabled him to gain a group of loyal supporters and strengthened the political foundation for supporting Wu Tingyan. But Wu Tingyan’s political and military status was not yet firm: Emperor Bao Bao hated Wu Tingyan and appointed him only because of political needs; the French regarded it as an enemy and hoped that his rule would collapse, and the French Expeditionary Force was still the most powerful military force in the South ; Wu TingyanThe Vietnamese National Army was originally created and trained by the French army . Its officers were appointed by the French. The commander-in-chief, Ruan Wenxin, was a French citizen. He hated Wu Tingyan and repeatedly defy Wu's orders. Ngo Dinh Diem also have the two religious denominations - Cao Dai and Hoa Hao struggle, they are in the Mekong Delta has its own army, which Caodaism army estimated at 25,000 people. Northern Vietnam Alliance estimates that it controls one third of the country. The situation in Saigon is the worst: the criminal group organized by the Pingchuan faction , which claims to have 40,000 troops, controls brothels , casinos , and opium factories that are unmatched in Asia . As the Emperor Bao Dai had the right to sell to the police Hirakawa school, resulting in a similar 1920 US Chicago is "underground mayor" Al Capone controlled the situation. In this way, Wu Tingyan's power can hardly exceed his official residence. With the firm support of Joseph Lawton Collins , the US Army’s ambassador special representative and former Army Chief of Staff , and Secretary of State John Foster Dulles , Wu Tingyan smashed Bao Hui’s cousin Bao Hui and the Chief of Staff of the South Vietnamese Army. Ruan Wenxin attempted to launch a coup.

After taking office, Wu Tingyan launched a nationwide anti-communist movement to wipe out the domestic Communist Party forces. In addition, he also launched a punishment against Gaotai , Hejiao and Pingchuan troops. Wu Tingyan also actively strives for foreign support. He once said: "I will not put him in my heart for all the reputation.... However, international friends should look squarely at the actual politics of South Vietnam and not be confused by lies." From 1957 , Wu Shi has conducted successive diplomatic visits, visiting the United States, Thailand , Australia , South Korea , India and other countries, seeking to improve South Vietnam's international status. [18] The government of the Republic of China that ruled Taiwan was also invited by the South Vietnamese government to send a " Republic of China Military Advisory Group in Vietnam " to assist the South Vietnamese government in establishing a political and war system . [19] The most important ally in South Vietnam is the United States. Between 1955 and 1959, the United States invested $1 billion in military, economic, technical, and material assistance in South Vietnam and sent military advisers to help establish the American army. President Eisenhower sent a letter to Wu Shi, promising that the United States would assist South Vietnam and "can be more efficiently shipped to Vietnam, and contribute more to the prosperity and stability of the Vietnamese government (South Vietnam)." [20]

A " strategic town " in the rural area of ​​South Vietnam

In 1959, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam decided to arm and reunite Vietnam, and sent a large number of military personnel to South Vietnam to organize armed subversion. On December 20, 1960, the " Southern Vietnam National Liberation Front " (known as Viet Cong in Western media, or "Vietnamese Communist Party") was established, and Ruan Youshou served as chairman of the National Liberation Front. In 1959, North Vietnam opened up the " Ho Chi Minh Trail " and transported materials to the Vietnamese Communist Party through this route to support its armed subversion activities, threatening the rule of the Saigon government. Within a few years, the National Liberation Front had controlled most of the rural areas of southern Vietnam. In 1961, US President John F. Kennedy decided to vigorously support the South Vietnamese Viet Cong armed forces, implement the "special war" plan, establish a " strategic eup " in the South Vietnamese countryside , and integrate the scattered rural areas, and focus on guarding to stop the Viet Cong guerrillas Team development. In 1962, Wu Tingyan announced in the Congress that the establishment of strategic euppies as the national policy of South Vietnam. However, the plan did not achieve the expected goals and results, but caused farmers to be dissatisfied, and the results were counterproductive. By 1964, most of the strategic cities had been infiltrated by the Viet Cong, and the plan failed.

South Vietnamese regime threatened not only by the Viet Cong - Ngo Dinh Diem as Catholic Christians, the implementation of the South Vietnamese government under the leadership of its partiality, Domination Catholic policies caused domestic Fojiao only dissatisfaction. In 1963, the conflict between South Vietnamese Buddhists and the government caused a series of incidents, and the Buddhist crisis broke out . The Hue Buddha’s birthday shooting occurred on May 8, 1963 ; the Hue chemical attack occurred on June 3 ; Shi Guangde opened himself on the streets of Saigon on June 11 [21] ; Wu Tingyuan also directed special forces to investigate on August 21 Saigon Relic Temple [22] .

The failure of the Wu Tingyan government to fight the communist regime and the errors in religious policies have caused the South Vietnamese military and political circles and the US Kennedy government to lose confidence in Wu Tingyan. August 24, 1963, the US State Department to the US Embassy in South Vietnam sent a cable 243 shows American disappointment for Ngo Dinh Diem, said it would "separate new leader of South Vietnam." [23] . On the morning of November 2nd, General Yang Wenming and a group of generals of the Republic of Vietnam army organized and arrested Presidents Wu Tingyan and Wu Tingyuan. It was a 1963 South Vietnamese coup , which ended the 9-year family rule of the Wu brothers' dictatorship and nepotism in South Vietnam for 9 years. [24] .

The frequency of political affairs and the intensification of the Vietnam War (1963–73) [ Edit ]

See also: 1964 South Vietnam coup , Beibu Gulf incident , September 1964 South Vietnam coup , 1965 South Vietnam coup , Spring Festival offensive , Easter offensive and Paris Peace Agreement
In 1965, the South Vietnamese National Liberation Front detonated a bomb in the center of Saigon

South Vietnamese political situation due to the death of Ngo Dinh Diem and 1:00 into the last about a year and a half of chaos. The " Military Revolutionary Committee " took over the South Vietnamese regime shortly after Wu Tingyan was assassinated. On November 4, 1963, the Military Revolutionary Committee promulgated an interim constitution, which stipulated that the chairman of the committee Yang Wenming act as the head of state, and the committee formed the interim government. However, only three months later, Minh criticized the regime because they tend to "neutralize" "Francophile" and other advocates for the military coup( English : 1964 South Vietnamese coup ) to overthrow the coup launched by Nguyen celebrate as president [25] .

The Beibu Gulf incident occurred during the same period (August 2, 1964) -an armed conflict between North Vietnam and the United States on the Beibu Gulf Sea. After the Beibu Gulf incident, the United States began to directly intervene in the Vietnam War and continued to increase support for the South Vietnamese Army, which further promoted the war. By the end of 1964, 200,000 US troops had been stationed on the battlefield. Ruan Qing tried to seize the opportunity to strengthen his power and declared a state of emergency in South Vietnam on August 7th, drafting a "Vung Tau Charter" to strengthen the power of the Military Council ( Vietnamese : Hiến chương Vũng Tàu / Charter Charter)), causing dissatisfaction. A series of demonstrations and strikes forced the military committee to abandon the proposal due to the situation. At the same time, conflicts between Catholics (supporting Ruan Qing) and Buddhists (supporting Yang Wenming) in South Vietnam continued. Then the military committee announced its dissolution and established a "temporary leadership committee" composed of three generals , Ruan Qing, Yang Wenming and Chen Shanqian , to form a national high-level committee , draft a constitution, and form a caretaker government . A failed military coup took place in South Vietnam in September 1964 , but it also forced Ruan Qing to decentralize again. In October, Nguyen celebrate no longer serve as head of state, the National High Commission nominated Panke ugly as president. [26]

A woman who was voting during the 1967 Vietnam referendum

In 1965, the anti-war movement in South Vietnam rose, and Buddhists who advocated peace mobilized many times in Saigon and Hue, causing bloody conflicts. In February of the same year, a failed coup occurred again . After several coups, Ruan Wenshao and Ruan Gaoqi gradually took power. Ruan Wenshao was appointed as the chairman of the National Leadership Committee (nominal head of state) on June 14; Ruan Gaoqi was appointed as the Prime Minister of South Vietnam on June 19. [27] In early 1966, a pro-Buddhist demonstration broke out in Da Nang , but it was soon resolved by the government . [28] A new constitution was promulgated in April 1967, stipulating the presidential election, and the referendum began on September 3. Ruan Wenshao was elected president with 34.8% of the votes, and Ruan Gaoqi became vice president.

In terms of warfare, from 1964 to 1968, the US military launched several land offensives and strategic bombings, and achieved certain results. By 1967, the total strength of the US troops stationed in Vietnam was nearly 470,000. Before and after the Spring Festival in January 1968 , North Vietnam launched an unprecedented Chinese offensive . The coalition forces estimated that the North Vietnamese army killed 2,500 to 5,000 people in the fierce battle in Hue, and 89 people became captives. [29] 216 US Army and Marine Corps soldiers were killed and 1,609 wounded. The South Vietnamese Army killed 421 people and injured 2,123 people, and 31 were missing. [29] : 213 Of the 140,000 indigenous people, more than 5,800 died and 116,000 were homeless. [29] : 216 is an important turning point for the Vietnam War, in which the battle of Hue is the most enduring and the fierce battle lasts for a month. The tragedy of the Spring Festival offensive caused an uproar in US domestic public opinion and the anti-war movement continued to soar. On March 31, 1968, US President Lyndon Johnson stated that the US military would gradually withdraw from the Vietnam battlefield and announced that it would abandon its election for the next president. The Vietnam War became the main topic of the US presidential election in 1968.

In 1969, Richard Nixon became the President of the United States, expressing the need to implement a " Vietnamization( English : Vietnamization ) " policy to gradually withdraw US troops from Vietnam. On October 3, 1971, South Vietnam was elected and Ruan Wenshao was re-elected. In 1972, North Vietnam launched an Easter offensive against the South, and after a fierce battle of about six months, the North Vietnamese army of the South invasion roughly defeated, resulting in the dismissal of General Wu Yuanjia of the Vietnamese People's Army . On January 27, 1973, the Paris Peace Agreement was signed. Within the next two months, all US troops stationed in Vietnam withdrew from South Vietnam, leaving only small-scale troops such as the guards of the Marine Corps Embassy , while the functions and responsibilities of the US Army stationed in Vietnam were handed over to the US military attaché in Saigon established in the same year. Room (DAO).

Military failure and fall (1973–75) [ edit ]

See also: Spring offensive in 1975 , the 430 incident and normal wind operations
On April 29, 1975, a helicopter flying from Saigon to the USS Hancock was unloading evacuated citizens of South Vietnam

According to the Paris Peace Agreement , US troops withdrew from South Vietnam and no longer participated in direct interference in the Vietnam War ; the North and the South reached a temporary ceasefire. The South Vietnamese Army, which was separated from the support of the US military, was unable to cope with the infiltration of the Viet Cong, but still occupied some of its land. In March 1973, North Vietnam also held a series of military meetings and decided to overthrow the South Vietnamese regime in 1976. On March 15, US President Richard Nixon hinted that if North Vietnam broke the ceasefire, the US military would send troops to intervene. Nixon's remarks were opposed by the general public. On June 4, the Senate passed a resolution prohibiting military intervention in Vietnam. In October, the oil crisis spread to South Vietnam, causing an economic recession. During the ceasefire period, North Vietnam and the Viet Cong did not terminate military infiltration, and their military operations killed 25,000 South Vietnamese people [30] . In January 1974, the Vietnamese Communist Party launched a counterattack in an attempt to recapture the previously lost territory; on January 4, President Ruan Wenshao announced a renewed war with the North.

In August 1974, US President Nixon resigned because of the Watergate scandal ; the US Congress voted at the same time to reduce aid to Vietnam from US$1 billion to US$700 million per year. North Vietnam has consolidated the Ho Chi Minh Trail for military aid to the Communist Party of China , and converted it into an automobile highway equipped with a gas station. In 1975, North Vietnam launched a spring offensive to march south. The Vietnam People’s Army of North Vietnam has advantages in equipment. The South Vietnamese Army, which lacks materials and weapons, has failed in defense and counterattack. Ruan Wenshao then voluntarily ordered the army to withdraw from the Central Highlands . The morale of the South Vietnamese army was severely hit, almost making the South Vietnamese army's defeat irreversible, and Hue, Da Nang and Da Lat were all captured. Ruan Wenshao requested the new US President Gerald Ford to send assistance, but the US Senate rejected the request on the grounds of financial problems. Ruan Wenshao, helpless, invited former political opponent Ruan Gaoqi to return to command the army, intending to save the decline. The battle of Chunlu conducted by the 18th Infantry Division under Liming Island in April 1975 was the last organized defensive battle of the South Vietnamese Army. On April 21, Chun Lu was broken, and Ruan Wenshao announced that he would resign from the presidency due to a defect in the defense of the metropolitan area and fled to Taiwan as a special envoy of the Republic of Vietnam , and appointed Vice President Chen Wenxiang to take over. Jobs to MinhGeneral. Yang Wenming's attitude towards North Vietnam is relatively mild. The political community hopes that he can reach a compromise agreement with the North to end the war, but in fact the North Vietnamese government is not interested in it. On April 30, the North Vietnamese armored soldiers entered Saigon and Saigon fell . On the same day, Yang Wenming announced an unconditional surrender and gave up the remaining territory [31] .

On the eve of the surrender of South Vietnam, the US military launched a large-scale rescue and evacuation operation. From the beginning of March, it began to evacuate South Vietnamese civilians and related US personnel to neighboring countries. By the end of the last evacuation operation, " Regular Wind ", more than 50,000 have been withdrawn. People, most of the people in Operation Normal Wind took the helicopter directly to the US aircraft carrier offshore, the largest helicopter evacuation operation in history, and finally evacuated more than 7,000 people, including more than 5,000 South Vietnamese and more than 1,000 people American and other nationalities. April 30 morning, "Operation Frequent Wind," declared cease, but there is still the South Vietnamese and foreigners who stay, some staff were also detained to North Vietnam in 1980 was able to release [32] .

After the surrender of South Vietnam, the South Vietnamese National Liberation Front took over the South Vietnamese regime and established the Provisional Revolutionary Government of the Southern Republic of Vietnam . In July 1976, the Democratic Republic of Vietnam (North Vietnam) merged with the Provisional Revolutionary Government of the Southern Republic of Vietnam to form the unified Socialist Republic of Vietnam , which has survived to this day.

Geography [ edit ]

South Vietnam has a land area of ​​173,809 square kilometers, which can be roughly divided into three geographical areas : coastal lowlands, central highlands and the Mekong Delta . The government also controls some islands in the Xisha Islands and Nansha Islands . In the battle of Xisha in 1974 , the South Vietnamese navy lost to the Chinese People's Liberation Army navy and lost control of the Xisha Islands. South Vietnam's highest peak is the geographical Annamite Range of jade lingqiu( English : Ngọc Linh ) , 2,598 meters above sea level. South Vietnam uses UTC+8 time as the zone time, one hour earlier than North Vietnam , which is consistent with the Philippines , Brunei , Malaysia , Singapore , China , Taiwan, and Western Australia . The land of South Vietnam is in a tropical monsoon climate region, with high temperatures throughout the year, a clear dry and rainy season, and the rainy season from May to October. The average annual temperature in the capital Saigon City is 25-29°C, and the annual precipitation is about 1,800 mm.

Politics [ edit ]

See also: List of leaders of South Vietnam
Independence Palace , the official residence of the President of South Vietnam, now known as the Reunification Palace

The Republic of Vietnam has undergone many political changes during its existence. Initially, the South Vietnamese head of state for the Nguyen Dynasty emperor Paul the Great , but the National regarded as an ally and partner of the French colonialists, and therefore undesirable. In 1955, Prime Minister Wu Tingyan abolished the monarchy through a referendum, established the Republic, and promulgated a new constitution in 1956. During the first five years of its rule, South Vietnam's politics, economy and society had undergone positive changes, and this made Wu Tingyan more assertive. In 1963, Yang Wenming and other Vietnamese generals launched a coup with the support of the US government and the CIA and assassinated Wu Tingyan . General Yang Wenming, who subsequently took the stage , was overthrown in General Ruan Qing ’s coup in 1964 . From then on until the end of 1965, there were several coups in succession in South Vietnam. The civil government was unable to rectify the chaos, and decided to return power to the military again. The military, because of lack of political experience, often caused factional disputes due to differences in handling local conflicts and other issues, making the political situation in South Vietnam chaotic. The authorities decided to change the political system more, set up a parliamentary system under the leadership of President, with the adoption of the system of the 1967 Constitution and stereotypes, after which the government essentially consists of Nguyen Van Thieu and Nguyễn Cao Kỳ control [28] [33] . Ruan Gaoqi was born in the Air Force and loves Western culture [33] , with the support of the United States and his allies behind him [33] , but since 1966, Westerners have doubted Ruan Gaoqi’s political ability. [34] Leaders also naturally incur national dissatisfaction [28]. In 1967, South Vietnam held presidential elections in accordance with the new constitution, and military nominee Ruan Wenshao was elected. After he was elected, he continued to implement a high-pressure policy, which disappointed voters who were open. In 1971, Ruan Wenshao once again won the election with an overwhelming advantage. He ruled until the eve of the Vietnam War. Yang Wenming was the last president of South Vietnam, and he was forced to surrender to the north soon after he took office.

Saigon Theatre , seat of the National Assembly of the Republic of Vietnam

According to the Constitution of the Republic of Vietnam adopted in 1967, the Republic of Vietnam followed the principle of the separation of powers between administration , legislation and justice . Congress controls the legislative power and is located at the Saigon City Grand Theater . The Congress includes the lower house and the upper house. The lower house has 159 members and a term of 4 years; the upper house has 60 members and the term is 6 years. Members of the House of Lords are elected by representatives, while members of the House of Commons are elected by voters from various places, the number of which is determined by the proportion of the local population; each member represents approximately 50,000 voters. The lower house, the Khmer representatives accounted for 6 seats, Highland clan representatives accounted for 6 seats, the northern peoples' representatives accounted for 2 seats, Cham representatives accounted for 2 seats [35] . The powers of Congress include voting on bills, discussing and approving international treaties and agreements, deciding battles and issues, supervising government governance, etc., and having the power to impeach the government by a two-thirds majority (if the president vetoes, it must reach a quarter Three majority). Local councils are set up at the local level. The term of office of the members is three years and they are responsible for handling local affairs. ( Vietnamese : Quốc hội Việt Nam Cộng hòa )

Jialong Palace , the seat of the Supreme Court of the Republic of Vietnam, is now the Ho Chi Minh City Museum

The President of the Republic of Vietnam has executive power. The president is elected by the citizens for a term of 4 years. The President is the head of state and the supreme commander of the army of the Republic , and the chairman of the National Security Council. The President has the power to enact laws, approve national policies, appoint prime ministers and cabinet members, appoint ambassadors and local executive heads, preside over cabinet meetings, sign international agreements and enforce martial law curfews. In 1974, the term of office of the president was extended from 4 years to 5 years, and a maximum of two consecutive terms. The vice president is the first successor of the president. When the incumbent president becomes vacant (he dies, resigns or is impeached), the vice president will succeed. At the same time, the Vice President also serves as Minister of Culture and Education, Chairman of the Social and Economic Conference and Chairman of the Minority Conference. The Prime Minister of the Republic is the head of government of the country and is responsible for leading the government. The general reason is assigned by the President and is responsible for the implementation of national policies. The government includes 19 ministries, each of which has a minister. These 19 departments include the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Ministry of Defense, the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the Ministry of Communications, the Ministry of Recruitment（英语：Chieu Hoi） , the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of Economics, the Ministry of Justice, the Ministry of Rural Development, the Ministry of Land Reform and Agriculture and Fisheries Development, the Ministry of Engineering, the Ministry of Transportation, Posts and Telecommunications, Ministry of Education, Ministry of Medical Relief, Ministry of Social Affairs, Ministry of Labor, Ministry of Veterans, Ministry of Minority Development, and Congress Liaison Department. The "Recruitment Department" is mainly responsible for the propaganda offensive against the Communist Party. In addition, the government also includes three secretaries of state, namely the Secretary of State for Culture, the Secretary of State for Reconstruction and Development, and the Secretary of State Office (Study Room).

The Supreme Court（越南语：Tối cao Pháp viện Việt Nam Cộng hòa） of the Republic of Vietnam has jurisdiction. The Supreme Court includes 15 judges, each with a term of 6 years. The powers of the Supreme Court include interpreting the constitution, judging whether the bill is constitutional, and dissolving unconstitutional parties. In addition, the Prosecutor's Office is another judiciary, including 9-18 prosecutors, each appointed by the President, Congress and the Supreme Court. The powers of the procuratorate include investigating corruption, investigating the property of government personnel, and supervising the legality of justice.

Diplomacy [ edit ]

The Republic of Vietnam has received diplomatic recognition from 87 countries including the United States [2] [3] . Due to the Cold War , communist countries including North Vietnam , the People’s Republic of China , and the Soviet Union did not recognize the Republic of Vietnam. The Republic of Vietnam used to be the Cultural and Scientific Cooperation Organization , Asian Development Bank , World Bank , International Development Association , International Finance Corporation (IFC), International Monetary Fund , International Telecommunications Satellite Organization , Interpol , International Olympic Committee , International Telecommunication Union , One of the member states of international organizations such as the International Red Cross Movement , UNESCO and the Universal Postal Union . In 1957, the United States nominated South Vietnam to join the United Nations . The vote of the UN General Assembly was 40 votes in favor and 8 votes against. It was vetoed by the Soviet Union when it was referred to the UN Security Council . Therefore, South Vietnam failed to join the UN [36] . （英语：Agence de Coopération Culturelle et Technique）

 United States [ edit ]

In 1957, US President Dwight Eisenhower and Secretary of State John Foster Dulles met with Wu Tingyan at Washington National Airport

As the pole of the Cold War , the United States is the most important diplomatic country in South Vietnam and the most important ally of South Vietnam during the war. The American decision has a decisive influence on the political and military situation in South Vietnam, and this was most obvious during the war. The South Vietnamese government often needs to consult the opinions of American advisers, while the military relies more on the advice or coordination of the US military.

The Geneva Conference of 1954 decided to conduct an election on the issue of reunification in Vietnam in 1956 [37] , but neither South Vietnam nor the United States signed the agreement. At the meeting, the representative of France adopted the proposal of “the elections are supervised by local committees” proposed by Fan Wentong , the representative of North Vietnam [38] , while the United States proposed that the election should be supervised by the United Nations [39] , with the support of South Vietnam and the United Kingdom, and the Soviet Union. The opposition of North Vietnam [39] . U.S. President Eisenhower wrote in 1954: "I have never spoken with any Indochina expert who disagrees with the holding of wartime elections. Perhaps 80% of Vietnamese nationals will choose Communist Ho Chi Minh as their leader instead of the National Security Council. Emperor. In fact, Vietnamese generally believe that Emperor Bao lacks leadership and driving force, and they are not willing to fight for such a leader." [40] Materials provided by the Pentagon [41] refer to the " Wu Tingyan regime from 1954 to 1956 The year did indeed achieve a miracle in South Vietnam", "It is almost certain that the nationals who voted for Ho Chi Minh will be less than 80%." [42] In 1957, independent observers from India, Poland and Canada called Vietnam at that year’s International Control Committee（英语：International Control Commission） meeting The unified elections cannot be fair, because the leaders of both the North and the South failed to abide by the armistice agreement [43]. In May of the same year, President Wu Tingyan visited the United States and carried out a state visit.

In 1968, Linden Johnson negotiated with Ruan Wenshao

In 1960, the South Vietnam National Liberation Front was established and began a guerrilla war with the South Vietnamese government in southern Vietnam. The United States initially sent military advisers to guide the training of the South Vietnamese Army and helped South Vietnam set up a strategic guerrilla guerrilla corps, but this policy was unsuccessful, as the historian James Gibson wrote: "The strategic empire plan failed... The South Vietnamese regime cannot Won the support of the peasants because they represent the landlord class. In fact, in terms of the relative stability of the political alliance and the operational level of bureaucracy, South Vietnam no longer has a'regime', and their local government work and military operations are almost caught Stagnation; and the National Liberation Front has made great progress and established a temporary revolutionary government in a wide area." [44] President John F. Kennedy increased his military assistance to Vietnam after he took office. He sent four times more than before. A large number of military advisory groups, and allow the advisory group to participate in combat operations; he then planned a coup and prompted Wu Tingyan to fall.

In 1965, Linden Johnson assumed the presidency of the United States and decided to directly intervene in the Vietnam War. In 1968, the North Vietnamese Army and the National Liberation Front launched a Spring Festival offensive . Although the US and South Vietnamese troops achieved partial victory and the National Liberation Front was weakened, the United States paid a huge price and the domestic anti-war movement rose. In 1969, Richard Nixon entered the White House , implemented the "Vietnamization of War" policy, and gradually withdrew from the Vietnam War. The U.S. forces basically withdrew in 1973, and the fighting between South Vietnam and North Vietnam continued until 1975, ending with the defeat of South Vietnam and the unconditional surrender. In July 1976, Vietnam was formally unified. The South Vietnamese Embassy in the United States donated 527 volumes of South Vietnamese film screenings to the Library of Congress on the eve of the closure . These films produced in the 1950s and 1960s included news films, documentaries, promos and some original films produced by South Vietnamese Free Pictures. Video clips. These donations are still hidden in the Library of Congress [45] .

 Japan [ edit ]

Main article: Japan-Vietnam relations

Japan declared a neutral policy during the Vietnam War and called on both parties to negotiate and resolve disputes. In 1969, the United States had high salaries to recruit Japanese to Vietnam, including work in the tug served on seafarers , etc. [46] . Many people were killed in the Vietnam War, and some Japanese working on US military ships were shot; therefore, Japanese public opinion at that time opposed the United States to send Japanese to participate in the Vietnam War, and there were also trade unions in Japan that protested to the US military. In September 1973, Japan established diplomatic relations with North Vietnam [47] .

 Republic of China [ edit ]

Main article: Relations between the Republic of China and South Vietnam

The Republic of China and South Vietnam share a common anti-communist position. Therefore, under the leadership of Wu Tingyan , the first President of South Vietnam, the relationship between the Republic of China and South Vietnam is very close to that of the Republic of China and other Southeast Asian countries. On October 26, 1955, the Republic of China recognized the Republic of Vietnam; on December 17, the two sides established diplomatic relations at the ministerial level and exchanged envoys [48] : 77 . The original consulate general of the Republic of China in Saigon was changed to a public embassy, ​​and the former consul general Jiang Enkai served as the consulate of the embassy. In 1956, Minister Yuan Zijian assumed office [49] . In 1957, the two sides upgraded the embassy to an embassy. The Embassy of the Republic of China in South Vietnam is located at 47 Pasteur Street [50] :74 near the US military headquarters in Vietnam , and then moved to 175 Zheng Queen Street [50] :75 ; The South Vietnamese Embassy in China is located on Ningbo West Street [50] :6 . On January 10, 1960, Wu Tingyan arrived in Taiwan for a visit and met with President Jiang Zhongzheng [51] ; from March 4 to March 9, 1963, Vice President Chen Cheng visited Vietnam and met with President Wu Tingyan and Vice President Ruan Yushu [52] . In 1969 Ruan Wenshao arrived in Taiwan for the first time and met with Jiang Zhongzheng. After 1971, Nguyen Van Thieu was elected president, when he was vice president ofYan Jiagan went to Saigon to attend his inauguration ceremony. Ruan Wenshao visited the Republic of China again in 1973.

On April 21, 1975, after Ruan Wenshao resigned as president, the first stop of exile was Taiwan. At the time, there were a considerable number of South Vietnamese students studying in the Republic of China. The ROC government has not yet sent troops directly involved in the Vietnam War , but there is still a considerable degree of support provided South Vietnam in the economic and political [53] . Therefore, the embassy of the Republic of China in Saigon was also attacked by guerrillas of the South Vietnamese National Liberation Front disguised as an overseas Chinese . [54] From 1964 to 1972, the embassy of the Republic of China in Nanyue was served by Hu Zhong , a close associate of Jiang Zhongzheng , while the ambassador of South Vietnam in the Republic of China was under the leadership of Wu Tingyan’s younger brother. The two capitals, Taipei and Saigon, form a sister city . However, in mid-April 1975, as the Saigon suburban fortress fell into the hands of the Viet Cong, the embassy personnel of the Republic of China in South Vietnam began to evacuate. The ambassador left Saigon on the 28th and officially closed. When Saigon fell on the 30th , the South Vietnam Airlines planes stranded at Songshan Airport became the first batch of planes at the beginning of China Airlines [53] . On the same day, the South Vietnam Embassy in the Republic of China announced the closure [50] :6 [55] .

 Republic of Korea [ edit ]

Main article: Korean-Vietnamese relations and South Korea sending troops to Vietnam
Republic of Korea Army White Horse Soldiers in Vietnam

In October 1956, South Korea established diplomatic relations with South Vietnam. In the 1960s, based on the US-ROK partnership, South Korea sent troops to assist the US military and the South Vietnamese government in the Vietnam War. From May 17 to 25, 1965, South Korean President Park Jung -hee visited the United States to consult with US President Lyndon Johnson . According to the agreement reached at that time, South Korea had to send 50,000 troops to join the Vietnam War. Throughout the 1960s, South Korea sent as many as 300,000 soldiers to the Vietnam War. [56] The Republic of Korea’s participation in the Vietnam War began with the first troop dispatch on September 11, 1964, and ended with the signing of the armistice agreement in 1973. On September 25, 1965, the Korean Army Command in Vietnam was established . As of April 1966, the South Korean National Army sent troops to Vietnam four times under the command of the Park Jung-hee government at the request of the United States . This was the first time the Republic of Korea regime had sent troops overseas. On September 11, 1964, a medical support company and the Taekwondo Instructor Regiment and other rear support troops were dispatched. Later, the Army Tigers and the Marine Corps Blue Dragon Forces were dispatched. In 1966, the White Horse Force was dispatched in accordance with the Brown Memorandum . As a rear support, a military-level force such as the Quartermaster Support Regiment and the White Gull Force ( military doctor ) was also dispatched . Army Lieutenant General Cai MingxinCommander of the South Korean Army in Vietnam [57] .

Southeast Asian countries [ edit ]

South Vietnam’s direct or indirect allies in Southeast Asia include Thailand and the Philippines . The relationship between South Vietnam and the Kingdom of Cambodia is not good. The Norodom Sihanouk regime in Cambodia does not recognize the legitimacy of Wu Tingyan’s regime. On February 2, 1956, Wu Tingyan announced the closure of the Vietnam-Cambodia border and the suspension of trade. In 1970, General Lonno of Cambodia launched a coup to seize power and establish the Khmer Republic . Lon Nol regime on May 5, 1970 to resume diplomatic relations with South Vietnam [58] . In 1964, South Vietnam announced that it would sever diplomatic relations with Indonesia because they did not recognize the legality of the Saigon regime.

Human rights [ edit ]

During the reign of Ngo Dinh Diem, the implementation of persecution Fojiao believers policy, triggering Hue Buddha shootings , Hue chemical attacks , check relic temple and release Guangde self-immolation and other events. The report provided by the Pentagon in the United States stated that Wu Tingyan’s regime “respected the personal and property safety of citizens more than other Asian governments during the same period” [59] . According to the survey, there are thousands of political prisoners in South Vietnam . [60] For the Ruan Wenshao regime, Western media accused the Ruan Wenshao regime of persecuting political prisoners, suppressing the opposition, and designing a narrow "tiger cage" to hold political prisoners, but a research report provided by US Congressman Leo Ryan said " The public’s accusation of suppressing human rights in South Vietnam is too biased, saying that “The Tiger Cage was originally designed to hold one person, but because of the large number of political prisoners, the number of prisoners had to be increased. This is in comparison with other isolation facilities in the country. better "" ...... for South Vietnam controlled media and suppress opposition accusations do exist, there is also a political prisoner in prison, but whether it is all the people, or the opposition leaders, have never been in the White Terror in " [61] .

Population [ edit ]

South Vietnam population density map (left) and South Vietnam ethnic map (right)

According to the census of South Vietnam that year, there were 16,259,334 people in South Vietnam in 1968. The rural population accounted for 71%, the urban population accounted for 29%, and the natural population growth rate was 2.2% [62] . The largest city in South Vietnam is Saigon, with 1,736,880 people. If the population of suburban counties is included, there are about 2,500,000 people. According to statistics from 1970, 90% of the ethnic groups of South Vietnam are ethnic Jing , and the remaining 10% are composed of Chinese , Highlanders , Khmer , Zhan , French and ASEM . Vietnamese is the official language of South Vietnam and the most important language in the country. Due to colonial historical factors, French still has an important position in the administration, education (especially in high schools and colleges), trade and diplomacy in South Vietnam, and is similar to the main language of the elite ruling class. Due to the strong influence of the United States on South Vietnam, English has gradually become the main language used in the military field and the second language in the field of diplomacy. Other languages ​​that exist in South Vietnam include Chinese , Khmer and Highland national languages [63] . Mahayana Buddhism is the first religion in South Vietnam . Catholicism is the religion believed by many ruling class people in South Vietnam. The believers also include President Wu Tingyan. Other religions in South Vietnam include Gaotai ,Religious reconciliation and pan-spiritual beliefs of the highland people .

Higher education [ edit ]

Before 1954, Saigon had a branch of Hanoi（越南语：Viện Đại học Đông Dương） University. After the signing of the Geneva Agreement in 1954, the campus was renamed the Vietnam National University, 1957 renamed Saigon College（越南语：Viện Đại học Sài Gòn） , the same year they opened Hue Hue School（越南语：Viện Đại học Huế） [64] . In 1973, Saigon University entered the international rankings, and sent doctoral students studying in the United States to study English courses and other professional courses [65] . Universities in South Vietnam also include Dalat University（越南语：Viện Đại học Đà Lạt） , Can Tho University（越南语：Viện Đại học Cần Thơ） , Wanxing University（越南语：Viện Đại học Vạn Hạnh） and Mingde University（越南语：Viện Đại học Minh Đức） . Between 1955 and 1973, the number of students at Nanyue University increased from 2,000 to 90,000, and the number of high school students increased from 45,000 to more than one million. In addition to the University general sense, South Vietnam is also provided with a two-year public college, to provide professional technical education, there are places in Sai Kung, Da Nang , Vinh Long and Nha Trang , etc. [64] .

Transportation [ edit ]

Bien Hoa Expressway

The domestic airports in South Vietnam include Tan Son Nhat International Airport , Cam Ranh International Airport , Da Nang International Airport , Nha Trang International Airport, Can Tho International Airport, and Bien Ho International Airport , etc., managed by South Vietnam Airlines , radiating Bang Meishu , Jinou , Can Tho , Dalat , Danang , Hue , Kon Tum , Nha Trang , Pan Lang - tower accounted City , Phan Thiet City , Phu Quoc , Pleiku , Guangde , generalized , qui Nhon , Rach Gia , Tamky City , Sui and There are 19 domestic destinations in Vietnam and Yongping [66] .

South Vietnam Airlines passenger planes and passengers, taken in 1961

The total length of water transportation lines in South Vietnam is 4,780 kilometers. Important port cities include Saigon, Cam Ranh, Da Nang, Nha Trang, and Dishi ; the total length of land transportation lines is 21,000 kilometers, of which 12,000 kilometers are paved with roads [67] ; about 4,000 bridges Part of it was destroyed during the war, but the damaged bridge will be repaired almost quickly [68] . As of 1974, there were 258,514 vehicles in South Vietnam, including 35,384 heavy trucks and 64,229 cars. Statistics do not include motorcycles. In 1969, because the economy was dragged down by inflation, the government decided to prohibit the import of vehicles from abroad [69] .

The first expressway system in South Vietnam was the Binhe Expressway, which was completed on April 28, 1961. In terms of railways, initially the main railway line in South Vietnam was the Trans-Indochina Railway built in 1936, but it was almost abandoned due to war in the 1950s. [70] Only the Tonghe-Da Nang Line and Saigon-Ninghe Line remained It can continue to be used. The government began to fund reconstruction in 1955, which was basically completed in 1959 [71] . In the 1960s, the domestic railway line was severely damaged again due to fighting. According to statistics from 1971 to 1972, only 57% of the 1,240-kilometer railway line in South Vietnam was in operation, but the number of passengers transported by railway was still rising.

Economy [ edit ]

Main article: Economy of the Republic of Vietnam
South Vietnam Economic Map

South Vietnamese economy belongs to the development of an open -style market economy . However, the promotion of its economic development is similar to the promotion model of the planned economy , which mainly relies on the government's five-year economic plan or four-year economic plan. Between 1954 and 1973, the industrial scale of South Vietnam grew at an average annual rate of 6.9%, power generation increased by 14 times [72] , and rice production increased by 203% [72] . In the first 10 years of the founding of the People's Republic of China, South Vietnam's economy was stable; from 1965 to 1969, South Vietnam's underground economy was booming, triggering an economic depression; successive battles, especially the large-scale Chinese New Year offensive in 1968, have shaken economic development. The oil crisis in 1973 and the withdrawal of the United States severely hit the South Vietnamese economy, triggering a high fiscal deficit , hyperinflation of 200% and a huge trade deficit [73] . In 1973, the United States provided US$2.3 billion to South Vietnam, but it fell to 1.1 billion yuan in the new year . [73] In order to improve the economic difficulties, the government carried out two rounds of land reform under the unavoidable situation . Through economic and technical assistance, the United States has played an important role in the South Vietnamese economic system.

Military [ edit ]

Main article: Army of the Republic of Vietnam
M41 light tank used by the South Vietnamese Army , taken in May 1960

On December 30, 1955, the Republic of Vietnam Army formally established its army, including the Army , Navy , Air Force , Volunteers,（英语：South Vietnamese Popular Force） and Civilian Guerrilla Defence Group . Material support and weapons and equipment support were basically provided by the United States. The South Vietnamese government set the tasks of the three armed forces as follows: protecting the Vietnamese republic and the sovereignty of the country; providing a stable domestic environment to maintain political, social order and regulations; defending the new regime from internal and external threats; the ultimate goal is to unify Vietnam.

The initial operational mission of the Republic of Vietnam Army was to fight against the FNL guerrillas in South Vietnam. To this end, US President Kennedy supported the South Vietnamese Army with a large amount of materials and sent an advisory team to provide military support, but then Wu Tingyan used the army to suppress the name of the Communist Party. with Cao Dai , Hoa Hao rebels fighting to mobilize the army raided Buddhist temples and so on, which allows Americans to lose confidence in Wu. In 1963, Wu Tingyan was assassinated, and the political situation in South Vietnam fell into chaos. The military forces were pivotal. During the same period, the Vietnam battlefield was basically dominated by the US military to fight against the North, and the status of the South Vietnamese Army was gradually declining. In addition, the South Vietnamese Army is even more troubled by the corruption of military officers, unable to organize effective operations, coupled with the problem of low training quality, and its combat power has been questioned. Examples of the defeat of the South Vietnamese Army include the Battle（英语：Battle of Ap Bac） of Beiyi in 1963, and about 1,400 South Vietnamese Army soldiers were repulsed by 350 guerrilla guerrilla forces; and the Battle of the same rank in 1965, in which about 2,000 South Vietnamese troops were defeated to 1,500 people The number of casualties of the FNL guerrillas is 416, which is about four times the number of casualties of the FNL guerrillas . [75]

The South Vietnamese Army Ranger Army fought on the streets of Saigon during the 1968 Spring Festival offensive

Since 1969, President Richard Nixon of the United States has implemented the policy of "Vietnamization" of war , withdrawing US troops stationed in Vietnam from the South Vietnamese territory, and handing over the task of fighting against North Vietnam to the South Vietnamese Army. The role of the South Vietnamese Army has also been reversed. The guerrilla force transformed into the only force in the south in the decisive battle between north and south. According to statistics from 1969 to 1971, about 22,000 South Vietnamese soldiers were killed each year, an increase since then. Since 1968, the South Vietnamese government has begun to expand its army, and by 1972 it had expanded to one million people. In 1970, the South Vietnamese Army ’s military progress in Cambodia went smoothly and performed well. The number of battles they launched in Cambodia was more than the total number of U.S. military engagements in the previous period. In the same year, the South Vietnamese Army also fought against the North Vietnamese Army in Vietnam. In the upper hand. However, the issue of officer corruption is the biggest disadvantage of the South Vietnamese Army; in addition, the signing of the 1973 Paris Peace Agreement gave the exhausted North Vietnamese Army a chance to breathe, and since then the South Vietnamese Army lacked supplies, support and equipment, compared to the Soviet Union and the people's Republic of China greater efforts to support the North Vietnamese troops did not prevail; and during the implementation of "strategic town" program, the South Vietnamese army to wipe out the Viet Cong often disregard public safety, so that military and civilian hostility. These are all shackles of the Nanyue army's combat power that are difficult to change qualitatively.

In 1972, North Yuan General Wu Yuanjia launched an Easter offensive , and the Yu army was assisted by a large artillery and armored force to go south. President Nixon sent large-scale air support to South Vietnam. Dissatisfied with the situation, President Ruan Wenshao dismissed wartime commander Huang Chunlan and ordered Wu Guangchang to take over. Wu Guangchang ordered the soldiers to be prevented from escaping their positions and placed heavy troops in Hue to block the North Vietnamese offensive. In the end, the South Vietnamese army basically repelled the North Vietnamese offensive, but the losses were extremely heavy and the combat power was heavily hit. After the evacuation of American troops in 1973, they were even more isolated. In 1975, North Vietnam launched a spring offensive and went south again. The South Vietnamese army that had lost its support was unable to support itself and was retreating. Some soldiers and civilians fled the country. The Battle of Chunlu was the last organized resistance of the South Vietnamese Army. It also ended in failure. The capital Saigon lost its last barrier. On April 30, 1975, Saigon fell and Yang Wenming announced his unconditional surrender. Throughout the war, approximately 1,394,000 people were killed and injured in the South Vietnamese Army . [76] [77]

South Vietnamese naval generals holding flags and military flags, taken in September 1969

The Navy of the Republic of Vietnam was established on August 20, 1955. The predecessor was the French Navy in Vietnam. The South Vietnamese Navy modernized and further developed by receiving the training of ships and personnel of the US Navy [78] . From 1962 to 1964, the scale of the South Vietnamese navy expanded rapidly. Many training facilities, maintenance bases and support facilities were successively built, communication equipment and combat networks were improved, and the organizational structure and administrative system were strengthened. The number of ships was expanded to 44 officers and men has increased to 8,100 people [79] . By the end of 1967, the South Vietnamese navy personnel have 16,300 names, 65 ships, river boats owned commando 232, 290 Rong grams vessels , and other types of vessels 52. After the implementation of the Vietnamization policy of the United States, it was decided to hand over the U.S. military boats on the river and coastal ships to the South Vietnamese Navy in stages, and the command of water operations was also handed over to the South Vietnamese Navy Command. From 1973 to 1974, the United States based on the "Paris Peace Accords" and slashed more financial aid to the South Vietnamese Navy was forced to halve action, river patrol and combat activities also reduced by 70% [80] . January 19, 1974, the South Vietnamese navy has worked with People's Liberation Army Navy to Paracel Islands sovereignty and the outbreak of skirmishes , won the People's Liberation Army in this post-war Paracel Islands. After the 1975 fall of Saigon, the South Vietnamese Navy ships carried out evacuation plans, heading the South China Sea , joined the heading Philippines Subic Bay, the US Navy's Seventh Fleet boat array [81] . After that, most of the ships of the former South Vietnamese Navy were incorporated intoUnder the Philippine Navy [80] .

The Air Force of the Republic of Vietnam was established on January 31, 1955. It was originally composed of a group of Vietnamese pilots who were selected to perform air services with the French Air Force during the Vietnam period . The South Vietnamese Air Force expanded with the intensification of war and the support of the US Air Force . By the heyday of 1974, it once became the sixth largest air force in the world in terms of the number of personnel and aircraft under its jurisdiction. Play a major role in After the collapse of Saigon in 1975, many Air Force officers and men moved to the United States.

Culture [ edit ]

A South Vietnamese girl dressed in Audrey , taken in Hue in the 1960s

Vietnamese traditional culture is deeply influenced by Chinese culture . In the 1960s, the middle class in South Vietnam developed and expanded, and more Western elements were added to the national culture , and Westernization deepened. Saigon City has become the center of the Westernization trend, closely following the West in terms of music, fashion and social trends.

Movies [ edit ]

The films produced in South Vietnam mainly include documentaries, public information films and feature films. The most famous feature film is " We Want to Survive（越南语：Chúng tôi muốn sống） " in 1956 ( Vietnamese : Chúng Tôi Muốn Sống / All 𪝬㦖𤯨), describing the social tragedy during the land reform in North Vietnam . The mid-1960s, South Vietnamese films produced mostly war theme, the famous actor of this period for some weeks Mao and Luo then new（越南语：La Thoại Tân） and so, after the emergence of the film depicts the war years of personal and family tragedies more than, for example, Johnson syndrome（越南语：Kiều Chinh） starring " no "Face Lover（越南语：Người tình không chân dung） " ( Vietnamese : Người tình không chân dung / If the love is true), "The Road Without Light " starring Qing'e（越南语：Thanh Nga） ( Vietnamese : Xa Lộ Không Đèn / The road is empty)（越南语：Xa lộ không đèn）), "Roadside Shadow" starring King Kong（越南语：Kim Cương (nghệ sĩ)） and Chengde（越南语：Thành Được） ( Vietnamese : Chiếc Bóng Bên Đường / only 𩄴 Biantang)Wait. There are also comedy films released during the Lunar New Year , such as "The Last Millionaire" starring Qing Yue ( Vietnamese : Triệu Phú Bất Đắc Dĩ / Mega Rich)).

Media [ Edit ]

Two female singer Pill (Tâm đan) and Fang Rong（越南语：Phương Dung） (Phương Dung)

Radio Vietnam is operated by the Government of the Republic of Vietnam and has four AM channels and one FM channel. Among the four channels, one is a national civil radio channel, one is a military radio station, one is a French channel, and one is a foreign language channel broadcast in Chinese, English, Khmer and Thai. Vietnam radio station in 1955, Ngo Dinh Diem start broadcasting period in power, while Minh is on April 30 December 1975 by the Republic of Vietnam radio station announced the surrender [82] . After the capture of Saigon, the Vietnamese Communist Party re-uses the channel band of the original Vietnamese radio station to broadcast state-run radio programs.

Television was introduced in South Vietnam on February 7, 1966. [83] The local broadcast standards established by the Federal Communications Commission [84] were used to broadcast black and white TV programs at night [85] . Some cities in South Vietnam can receive TV signals [85] , and the broadcast time of TV stations has also increased from 1 hour [86] at the time of broadcast to 6 hours in 1970 [87] . Among them, Channel 9 is Vietnam Television channels [85] , the channel playback Vietnamese news, entertainment, documentaries and educational programs. At that time the South Vietnamese people used to get together to watch television [88] . In addition, there are five local TV stations in South Vietnam [89] . The American radio and television (in 1967 renamed the Vietnamese American Broadcasting Network) has also broadcast in South Vietnam, the US military until the Paris peace agreement after the signing of the withdrawal of Vietnam so far [83] .

In terms of newspapers, according to the report of the Christian Science Monitor in 1970, after the South Vietnamese government promulgated a new press law in December 1969, South Vietnam’s press freedom ranked among the best in Southeast Asia. However, the government was restricted by the "News Act", and as a result, it was unable to seal down 30 newspapers operating in Saigon, including the "Morning News" . [90]

Sports [ edit ]

In 1959 Thailand Southeast Asia Peninsula Games , the South Vietnamese National Football Team won the gold medal in the football match

South Vietnam established the Olympic Committee in 1952 and sent delegations to participate in 1952 [91] , 1956 [92] , 1960 [93] , 1964 [94] , 1968 [95] and 1972 [ Vietnam ] 96] A total of 6 Summer Olympic Games , no medals.

The South Vietnam National Football Team was established in 1949, participated in the 1974 World Cup qualifiers, defeated Thailand 1-0 in the split game , and then divided into Group C with the Hong Kong team and Japan team . Lose 0 points and lose 5 goals. The South Vietnamese National Football Team participated in the Asian Cup of 1956 and 1960 , both of which won the fourth place; also participated in the Asian Cup qualifiers in 1964 , 1968 and 1976, but failed to qualify for the main round . In the 1959 Southeast Asian Peninsula Games in Thailand , the South Vietnamese team won the gold medal in the football match. In the subsequent Southeast Asian Games in 1965, 1967, 1971 and 1973, the South Vietnam team won 2 silver and 2 bronze.

    Original text

    Contribute a better translation

    越南南方民族解放阵线，西方及当时的南越习称为“越共”，是越南战争期间，越南劳动党在南越成立的反抗南越政权的统一战线组织。
